page.title: 05Kirdford Growers.
page.content: Kirdford Growers is a fruit storage and distribution plant run as a co-operative.The business has been in existance for 62-64 years. The business was started in a cow shed by five farmers. They sent up several hundred apples to Covent Garden for sale. The people who bought the apples were pleased with the quality and asked where the apples had come from, so the farmers set up in business. There are 98 employees there now. They come from the surrounding area. A convoy of lorries arrives at the site carrying loads of apples from the farms.When the fruit arrives at the plant it is washed,sorted and graded into different sizes. Then they are packed into boxes ready for storage or delivery.
